message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.CV 

This paper is about using a sequence-to-sequence abstractive summarization model augmented with domain-specific ontological information to generate accurate summaries from clinical reports. The paper focuses on the application of this method to a dataset of radiology reports. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing and computational linguistics. 

The paper also uses machine learning techniques to improve the accuracy of the generated summaries, which makes it relevant to the sub-category cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper uses ontological information to enhance content selection, which is relevant to the sub-category cs.IR (Information Retrieval). 

The paper also uses deep learning techniques to generate the summaries, which is relevant to the sub-category cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper deals with radiology reports, which are image-based, and therefore, the sub-category cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is also relevant.
